enabled.title: Enabled state
enabled.description: The enabled state is the default state of the component. It signifies that the component is interactive and actionable.

hover.title: Hover state
hover.description: The hover state is triggered by a mouse event and does not exist on devices that donâ€™t use mouse navigation. It indicates to the user that they can interact with it. It should be clear and visually different from the enabled and focus state.

focus.title: Focus state
focus.description: The focus state is used to highlight a component that is ready to receive an input. For example, inputs can include a click, entry of data, or selection between multiple options. There can only be one focused element at a time. All interactive elements on a page should be able to receive focus by navigating with a keyboard. This should be visually different to the hover and enabled state. Focus is often used for components that can be active/inactive.

disabled.title: Disabled state
disabled.description: Use the disabled state when a component should not be interacted with at that specific time. This state usually changes once a user has completed a required action.
